alert.note: Alert for Catskills; Middle Hudson Valley (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 07 at 6:33AM EDT until April 07 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR THE MID HUDSON VALLEY AND CATSKILLS... The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a Red Flag Warning for low RH and gusty winds, which is in effect from noon today to 8 PM EDT this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zone 208 Middle Hudson Valley and Fire Weather Zone 209 Catskill. * Timing...Noon to 8 pm EDT. * Winds...Northwest 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 25 percent. * Temperatures...In the mid 40s to mid 50s. * Lightning...None. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended. The annual statewide burn ban is in effect until May 14th. No burn permits are issued.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
